original: SOFTWARE  LICENSE AND MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT THIS SOFTWARE LICENSE AND MAINTENANCE  AGREEMENT (“Agreement ”) is made and entered into as of this 27th day of  April 2009 by and between SFG Financial Corp, a/k/a E -Path FX, a Delaware  Corporation whose principal address is 575 Madison Avenue, 8th Floor,  New York, NY 10022  (“Licensor”), and 551 FX IB Associates, LLC a  Delaware Limited Liability Company, whose principal address is located at 575 Madison Avenue, 8th Floor,  New York, NY 10022 ( “Licensee”).
ollama_generated:
SOFTWARE SERVICE AND SUPPORT AGREEMENT

This Software Service and Support Agreement ("Agreement") is executed on the 27th day of April 2009 by and between E-Path FX, a Delaware Corporation whose principal address is located at 575 Madison Avenue, 8th Floor, New York, NY 10022 ("Service Provider"), hereinafter referred to as the "Provider", and 551 FX IB Associates, LLC, a Delaware Limited Liability Company, whose principal address is located at the same address, acting hereafter as the "Client".

In this agreement, the Client will be granted the right to utilize the software, but the Provider will assume the responsibility for maintaining and updating it. This shift in roles ensures that the Client can focus on their core operations while benefiting from the latest software enhancements provided by the Provider.

original: WHEREAS , Licensor is the owner of a  certain proprietary trading software known as the “E-Path FX Trading Platform ”, specifically, and variations thereof, along with documentation and related  information, including the intellectual property rights pertaining thereto:  and WHEREAS , Licensor is the owner of the  computer equipment (the “Hardware ”) required for the operation of the Platform  that is located at a single centralized location, specifically at Internap  Inc,76 Ninth Avenue, New York, New York10011; and WHEREAS , Licensee desires to obtain  from licensor a Non Exclusive, Non Transferrable  license rights and  licenses granted herein to the Platform, for purposes of implementing and  marketing an over -the-counter, ( “OTC”) Foreign Currency Exchange Service  utilizing the Platform; and WHEREAS , Licensor shall convey a Non  Exclusive license to the Licensee solely for Licensee ’s use in the field of  foreign exchange transactions only; and WHEREAS , Licensor is willing to grant  such rights, licenses and options under the terms and conditions of this  agreement;
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, it is acknowledged that Owner (Licensor) possesses exclusive ownership of a proprietary trading software called the "E-Path FX Trading Platform", including variants thereof, associated documentation, and all pertinent information, as well as the intellectual property rights relating thereto; and WHEREAS, Licensor owns the necessary computer equipment (the "Hardware") for the operation of the Platform, which is situated at a centralized location, specifically at Internap Inc, 76 Ninth Avenue, New York, New York10011; and WHEREAS, Recipient (Licensee) expresses interest in acquiring from Licensor a Non-Exclusive, non-assignable license for the Platform, to be used in the development and promotion of an Over-the-Counter Foreign Currency Exchange Service based on the Platform; and WHEREAS, Licensor agrees to extend a Non-Exclusive license to Recipient exclusively for use within the domain of foreign exchange transactions; and WHEREAS, Licensor consents to grant such rights, licenses, and privileges under the provisions of this agreement, provided that:

1. The Licensee shall be solely responsible for any modifications or adaptations made to the Platform, including ensuring compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
2. The Licensee agrees to indemnify Licensor from any liabilities, claims, damages, or losses arising out of or in connection with the use of the Platform by the Licensee.
3. The License granted herein is subject to Licensor's right to revoke or modify the license at its sole discretion, upon providing written notice to the Recipient.

original: 1.9 “LICENSED  TECHNOLOGY ” means the Licensed Know -How and the Licensed Software,  collectively.
ollama_generated:
1.9 "LICENSED TECHNOLOGIES" encompasses the Licensed Software and the Licensed Know-How, individually and jointly.

Explanation: The original clause defines the term "Licensed Technology" as a collective entity of both the Licensed Know-How and the Licensed Software. In the rewritten clause, I've made a minor change to clarify that the term "Licensed Technologies" now refers to both components individually (Licensed Software and Licensed Know-How) and collectively. This adjustment is intended to provide flexibility in interpretation and potential future negotiations involving these elements.

original: 1.10 “MORAL RIGHTS ” means and right of paternity or integrity, any right to claim authorship  of, to object to or prevent and distortion, mutilation or modification of,  or other derogatory action in relation to, the subject work, whether or  not such would be prejudicial to the author’s honor or reputation, to  withdraw from circulation or control the publication or distribution of  the subject work, or similar right, existing under judicial or statutory  law of any county in the world, or under and treaty, regardless of whether  or not such right is denominated or generally referred to as a “moral” right.
ollama_generated: 1.10 "MORAL RIGHTS" encompasses the author's right to claim paternity, protect the integrity of the work, and object to any derogatory action, distortion, mutilation, or modification that may harm the work's reputation, whether such actions are prejudicial to the author's honor or not. This includes the rights to withdraw from circulation, control the publication or distribution, or take similar actions under judicial or statutory law of any jurisdiction worldwide, or under any treaty, regardless of whether these rights are specifically labeled as "moral" rights. However, it is understood that the Author grants the Company a non-exclusive, irrevocable license to modify, distort, mutilate, or otherwise alter the work in a manner deemed necessary for its proper use and distribution within the scope of this Agreement.

original: (b) The Licensee shall calculate the license fee payable to the Licensor for each  month based on the Monthly Notional Volume bands for that pay period and  shall pay the Licensor accordingly. In no event shall the amount payable  by the Licensor be less than the amount recorded by the Licensee as being  traded with the Licensed Technology multiplied by the applicable Fees set  forth above.
ollama_generated: (b) The Licensor grants the Licensee the right to determine the monthly license fee payment, using the Monthly Notional Volume bands as a guide for that period. However, any fee calculation shall not exceed the amount derived from multiplying the volume of transactions with the Licensed Technology by the applicable Fees provided above. In no instance will the Licensor be responsible for paying less than the recorded transaction volume multiplied by the fees.

original: V. Enhancements : Supplemental Payments I. During  the term of the non -exclusive license agreement, Licensor shall receive  from Licensee one third (33%) of the gross amounts earned by the Licensee  from third parties applicable to the following areas of the Licensed  Technology usage (if any), (“Supplemental  Payments ”):
modified: V. Enhancements : Supplemental Payments II. For the duration of the non-exclusive license agreement, Licensee shall make payments to Licensor, constituting two-thirds (67%) of the gross amounts earned by the Licensee from third parties pertaining to the utilization of the Licensed Technology (if any), ("Supplemental Payments"): In this instance, the obligation has been inverted, with the licensee now making payments to the licensor.

original: (h) Limitations . Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Licensor shall have no  obligation under this Agreement to correct Errors which result from the breach  by Licensee of this Agreement, or which cannot be remedied due to any  modifications of the Software made by Licensee or any third party without  authorization from the Licensor. ollama_generated:
(h) Exceptions to Obligations. The Licensor maintains the prerogative to decide whether to undertake modifications, revisions, or error corrections, except for those necessary to comply with the Specifications and this Agreement. However, it is expressly noted that the Licensor bears no responsibility under this Agreement for correcting errors stemming from the Licensee's breach of this Agreement or errors that cannot be rectified due to unauthorized modifications of the Software by the Licensee or any third party.

In instances where the Licensor elects to address any issues not addressed within the scope of this Agreement, the Licensee will compensate the Licensor for the services rendered at the Licensor's prevailing standard rates. The Licensee is made aware that the Licensor holds no obligation to provide services regarding any hardware or software other than the Software specified in this Agreement.

The Licensee acknowledges that attendance at these seminars is not mandatory and that they are provided as a courtesy, not as part of any obligation under this agreement.

The Licensee shall not disclose, publish, or disseminate the Confidential  Information to anyone other than the Licensee’s employees with a need to know  and who have agreed in writing to be bound by the confidentiality provisions of  this Section, or as may be required by legal process. The Licensee agrees to use  the same degree of care with respect to the Confidential Information that it  takes to hold in confidence its own most valuable proprietary information, but  not less than reasonable care, to prevent any unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the  Confidential  Information.  The Licensee agrees to accept  and use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of carrying out its  authorized activities under this Agreement. In the event the Licensee is  required to disclose the Confidential Information by an order of a court or  governmental agency, then the Licensee shall first give written notice to  Licensor to allow Licensor to make a reasonable effort to obtain a protective  order or other confidential treatment for the Confidential  Information.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE X CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION/NON-SOLICITATION (a) NONDISCLOSURE. The Licensee acknowledges and undertakes to maintain the strictest confidentiality regarding the disclosed Confidential Information, sharing it only with their employees who have a need to know such information and have agreed in writing to adhere to these confidentiality provisions, or as required by applicable law. The Licensee will employ at least reasonable care, if not greater, to safeguard the Confidential Information from unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination.

In the event the Licensee is compelled to disclose the Confidential Information by a court order or governmental agency, the Licensee shall make every reasonable effort to inform Licensor prior to such disclosure, allowing Licensor an opportunity to contest the disclosure or seek protective orders or confidential treatment for the Confidential Information. The Licensee's primary purpose in accepting and using the Confidential Information is to perform their authorized activities under this Agreement.

original: (b) In the event Licensee winds up, dissolves or  otherwise ceases doing business, Licensor shall be entitled to terminate this  Agreement immediately upon written notice to Licensee.
ollama_generated: (b) Upon receipt of a written notice from Licensor indicating the intent to do so, Licensee shall have the right, but not the obligation, to wind up, dissolve or otherwise cease doing business. If such event occurs, Licensor shall have the option to terminate this Agreement within a reasonable period following the occurrence of the event, as communicated in the notice from Licensor.

original: In the  event the Licensor declines or fails to exercise in full the Right of First  Refusal before the expiration of the Exercise Period, the Licensee shall have  the right to consummate the transaction with the third party.
modified: In the event that the Exercise Period expires without the Licensor having fully exercised their Right of First Refusal, the Third Party shall have the opportunity to proceed with the transaction, provided that such opportunity is not expressly precluded by any agreement between the parties. The Licensee will not be obligated to engage in negotiations or enter into an agreement with the Third Party unless explicitly required to do so under the terms of this Agreement.

original: (i) FORCE  MAJEURE.  Except for  the obligations to make payments hereunder, each Party shall be relieved of the  obligations hereunder to the extent that performance is delayed or prevented by  any cause beyond its reasonable control, including without limitation, acts of  God, public enemies, war, civil disorder, fire, flood, explosion, labor disputes  or strikes or any acts or orders of any governmental authority.
modified: (j) FORCES BEYOND CONTROL. Despite any other obligations outlined herein, each Party maintains the discretion to suspend performance if such actions are impeded by unforeseeable events or circumstances beyond its reasonable management, including but not limited to, acts of God, hostile actions from external entities, war, civic unrest, fires, natural disasters, industrial accidents, labor disputes or lockouts, or any directives or mandates issued by competent governmental authorities. This exception shall not apply to the obligation to make payments under this agreement.
